intro: Phyllanthus baeckeoides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a perennial shrub native to tropical Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and features opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resistance to drought. The leaves and roots of Phyllanthus baeckeoides have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
